H0.text: Gamma radiation is the wavelengths of electromagnetic radiation that scientists use large optical telescopes to obtain information about the planets in the solar system.

H1.text: Infrared radiation is the wavelength of electromagnetic radiation that scientists use with large optical telescopes to obtain information about the planets in the solar system.

H2.text: Radio waves are the wavelengths of electromagnetic radiation that scientists use with large optical telescopes to obtain information about the planets in the solar system.

H3.text: Visible light is the wavelength of electromagnetic radiation that scientists use with large optical telescopes to obtain information about the planets in the solar system.

A4.text: An optical telescope gathers and focuses light mainly from the visible part of the electromagnetic spectrum
